successes.title: Fantagraphics 2014 Spring Season: 39 Graphic Novels & Books
successes.description: Invest in our spring season and be a part of the company that has published the best cartoonists in the history of the world.

Pledges.description: Blighted Eye ROBERT WILLIAMS PRINT: Entitled “Gaudi,” celebration of the architect Antonio Gaudi, originally published in Gothic Blimp Works, 1970. Signed.
Jack Davis Signed Print ($25): "BOO" A signed 9x12 print by THE Jack Davis
Signed Jim Woodring Print ($200): A hippocamp fighting (or loving, you decide) a scolpendra as seen in BEASTS 2. Size? Huge. Measurements to come.
Gary adds you to his prayers
Thank you card signed by the staff Fantagraphics
STICK IT: Stickers featuring the heads of Gary Groth, Kim Thompson (RIP), Eric Reynolds and our fabulous Dan Clowes shield

Sublife Vol. 2: The acclaimed graphic novel anthology by John Pham returns. Sprawling L.A. saga "221 Sycamore St." and psycho-comical sci-fi fantasia "Deep Space" continue, plus the post-apocalyptic adventure "The Kid" and a variety of short strips, signed
GUARDSMAN OF INFINITY #1: Gary's early fanzine, signed (circa 1969-1970)
ORIGINAL ART PORTRAIT: A Fantagraphics' employee will draw you or a pet
BATTER UP, CHARLIE BROWN! A gift book collection of the best baseball related strips in Peanuts' 50 years. (64 pages) by Charles M. Schulz
TEAM FANTA SHIRT: A black shirt with white print that states or screams "F*CK YOU, I'M WITH FANTAGRAPHICS". Sans asterisk, of course.
PRE-ORDER SIGNED SOCK MONKEY: Sock Monkey: Into the Deep Woods signed by Tony Millionaire
PRE-ORDER SIGNED BUMF: Bumf signed by Joe Sacco
PRE-ORDER THE AMATEURS: The Amateurs signed by Conor Stechschulte
JACK DAVIS SIGNED PRINT: "BOO" A signed 9x12 print by THE Jack Davis
LOVE & ROCKETS TRADING CARDS: a full color set of 36 trading cards (images from the trading card poster!) with stories and stats on the back of the cards.
BLECKY YUCKERELLA SIGNED: Johnny Ryan's Blecky Yuckerella and her disgusting pals star in this weekly four-panel gag strip, as seen in the pages of the Portland Mercury and Vice magazine.  104 pages

BUDDY DOES JERSEY Signed: Collects Peter Bagge's Hate #16-30 in pristine black and white. This 352 graphic novel details the riotous Buddy Bradley saga with his tumultuous relationships, his sometime girlfriend Lisa, and his junkie business partner Jay.

GIRL FROM H.O.P.P.E.R.S signed (Locas Book 2) Love and Rockets Library: Centered on one of Jaime Hernandez's peaks, "The Death of Speedy," the second comprehensive "Locas" collection alternates between wrestling action and the triangle of Maggie, Hopey and Ray D.

SKIN DEEP signed: Charles Burns' classic stories starring Dog Boy and Mister Blister, as well as several tales of doomed romance and creepy revulsion, plus a selection of sketchbook excerpts, covers and illustrations in this 96 page softcover.
BUDDY DOES SEATTLE signed: These legendary stories from Peter Bagge's  Hate #1-15 are a defining icon of Seattle's early 1990s culture, as well as Generation X in general. Signed by Bagge.

CHOCOLATE CHEEKS signed: Bitter enemies "Sweet" Chubby Cheeks and Pullapart Boy are stuck with each other, despite trying to make some icky new friends. Hilariously horrible strips give way to suspense and terror when Steven Weissman draws the nastiest kids you've ever seen in this 112 page graphic novel, signed.

CHANCE IN HELL signed: Gilbert Hernandez's 120 page graphic novel follows the life of a young girl adopted out of a hellish slum by a decent man. She eventually marries a kind, well-to-do man, but finds that she can't escape the darkness and violence she left behind. Signed.

JESSICA FARM VOL. 1 signed: Like a Lynchian take on Alice in Wonderland, Josh Simmon's atmospheric 96 page graphic novel fuses serialized adventure, fantasy and psychological horror and stamps it with Simmons' signature macabre sensibility, signed by cartoonist.

MEAN signed: Steven Weissman's early, self-published, unpublished, and otherwise rare "Yikes" comics. Enjoy your favorite characters' awkward stumbles from their early, crude glory into their mature sadistic and masochistic selves, Signed by Weissman.
KIM THOMPSON MEMO ZINE: The best of Kim Thompson's acerbic correspondence in this exclusive zine.
ACTION SUITS ALBUM - COLUMBIA: Action Suits (Eric Reynolds' band) 7 inch record with album art by Al Columbia. Signed by Reynolds and Columbia
ACTION SUITS ALBUM - BAGGE: Action Suits (Eric Reynolds' band) 7 inch record "Cancer Father / Visualize Ballard" with album art by Peter Bagge. Signed by Reynolds and Bagge
PORTFOLIO REVIEW: A phone or Skype portfolio review with Associate Publisher Eric Reynolds (30 minutes)
PRE-ORDER SIGNED THE COMPLETE PEANUTS 1991-92: The Complete Peanuts 1991-92 signed by Tom Tomorrow
PRE-ORDER SIGNED THE LOVE BUNGLERS: The Love Bunglers (104 page graphic novel) signed by Jaime Hernandez
PRE-ORDER SIGNED LUBA AND HER FAMILY: Luba and Her Family (312 page graphic novel) signed by Gilbert Hernandez
PRE-ORDER SIGNED GAST: Gast signed by Carol Swain
Free year membership to the Cartoon Art Museum in sunny San Francisco
CHRIS WARE POSTER: a 14x20 poster featuring Chris Ware's artwork/design used as the full wrap-around cover of the Crockett Johnson and Ruth Krauss biography by Phil Nel

CATHY MALKASIAN SOAP ($30): A set of three handmade soaps based on characters from Cathy Malkasian's Percy Gloom and Temperance graphic novels created by the cartoonist herself. A few have a little dye that rubbed off on their cute faces from the tissue paper.
SIGNED JULIO'S DAY: a signed copy of Gilbert Hernandez's 2013 opus. 104 page black and white graphic novel
TIM LANE DUST BOWL LINOLEUM PRINT: "Congress Created Dust Bowl" linoleum print approximately 6.5x5.75" printed by the cartoonist himself, signed and numbered.
TIM LANE COWBOY LINOLEUM PRINT: "The Cowboy" linoleum print approximately 5x7" printed by the cartoonist himself, signed and numbered.

BENT SIGNED: A bizarre procession of milky, twitching, agitated women wriggles through an undulating, overripe world in this collection of 5 years worth of paintings, drawings & photos collected and signed by Dave Cooper.

THE EDUCATION OF HOPEY signed: In these "Locas" stories by Jaime Hernandez, Ray pursues the train-wreck bombshell "Frogmouth"; an eventful week in the life of Hopey; and Maggie, off stage but visible as Ray's resentful ex and (forever and still) Hopey's best friend. Signed by Jaime.

GHOSTS OF HOPPERS signed (Love and Rockets #22): In this 120 page graphic novel by Jaime, Maggie hosts an unstable houseguest, Izzy Ortiz; meets Vivian the "Frogmouth" and gets swept up in her dangerous life; and returns to Hoppers to retrieve a stolen art object from Izzy, finding more than she bargained for!

LUST signed: Cartoons celebrating the sometimes stunningly crude, sometimes surprisingly sweet world of personal classifieds. Ellen Forney illustrates the most interesting, outrageous, or idiosyncratic ad in each week's The Stranger collected in this 168 page volume, signed.

PETEY AND PUSSY SIGNED: This graphic novel debut reads very much like a Loony Tunes cartoon — if all of the anthropomorphic animals were kvetching, balding, foul-mouthed misanthropes. A twisted combination of mundane realism and gross-out slapstick in 128 pages, signed by John Kerschbaum.
TEMPERANCE signed: Cathy Malkasian's galvanizing work of empathy and violence, she is one of today’s most thoughtful and accomplished cartoonists. 240 page graphic novel.

HO! THE MORALLY QUESTIONABLE CARTOONS OF IVAN BRUNETTI, signed: The vast majority of Brunetti's morally questionable, aesthetically confused — and absolutely gut-busting — “gag” cartoons, discreetly presented in an uninviting, funereal package of unglamorous black and white, signed by Brunetti.

WEATHERCRAFT signed: Jim Woodring's brutish Manhog is sent on a transformative journey of suffering to achieve enlightenment and faces Whim, the embodiment of evil, in a final battle, with Frank, Pupshaw and Pushpaw along for the ride, signed.

UNCLOTHED MAN signed: Collecting Shaw's storyboards, scripts, character designs, etc. for his original animated shorts for IFC.com along with his acclaimed Mome short stories and more new material from one of comics' most restless innovators, signed.

COMPLETE CRUMB VOL. 2: Comic collection featuring several key stories from Crumb’s pre-underground, homemade comics of the early 1960s (such as Farb and Arcade), with stories featuring early characters Fritz the Cat, Jim, Mabel, and Little Billy Bean. Signed by Crumb.

THE COMPLETE CRUMB VOL. 3: "Starring Fritz the Cat" includes Crumb's classic original Fritz stories from 1965, plus much rare art, some of Crumb's long-lost American Greeting cards from the '60s, and more. Plus the story of Crumb's first acid trip!

THE COMPLETE CRUMB COMICS VOL. 13: Crumb's classic "social and environmental" rants: the now-famous "A Short History of America"; gritty "American Splendor" with Harvey Pekar; the quintissential "My Troubles with Women"; and the very first "Snoid" comics! SIGNED.

THE COMPLETE CRUMB COMICS VOL. 15: "Mode O'Day and Her Pals" includes all of Crumb's contributions to Weirdo #9-15, his first experiments with brush, the first Mode O'Day stories, the first collaboration with Bukowski, "Psychopathia Sexualis" and more! Signed.

THE COMPLETE CRUMB COMICS VOL. 5: Another year's worth of prize Crumb, including the second issue of Zap!, the introduction of Angelfood McSpade, Mr. Natural, a long Fritz story, an alternate version of the Cheap Thrills album cover, and more! Signed.

THE COMPLETE CRUMB COMICS VOL. 6: Entering the '70s, this volume includes a couple of genuine rarities, as well as all of Crumb's work from Big Ass #1, Zap #4 (with the legendary, X-rated "Joe Blow" teen incest strip) and more offensive classics. SIGNED
PRE-ORDER SIGNED BUDDY BUYS A DUMP: Buddy Buys a Dump (144 page graphic novel) signed by Peter Bagge
PRE-ORDER SIGNED HOW TO BE HAPPY: How to Happy (144 page graphic novel) signed by Eleanor Davis
PRE-ORDER SIGNED TWELVE GEMS: Twelve Gems (220 page graphic novel) signed by Lane Milburn
PRE-ORDER SIGNED TALES DESIGNED TO THRIZZLE VOL. 1: The paperback edition of Tales Designed to Thrizzle Vol. 1 (160 page graphic novel) signed by Michael Kupperman
PRE-ORDER SIGNED SPECIAL EXITS: paperback edition Special Exits (208 page graphic novel) signed by Joyce Farmer
PRE-ORDER SIGNED LONESOME GO: The Lonesome Go (220 page graphic novel) signed by Tim Lane
HENRY SPEAKS FOR HIMSELF: 160 page comics strip collection by John Liney (created by Carl Anderson). Tintin-esque and kid-friendly comics!
SIGNED ALMOST SILENT: Jason's 304 page hardback graphic novel that packages 4 stories, three of them out of print since 2008.

BUT I LIKE IT signed: Joe Sacco hits the rock 'n' roll beat. Joe follows punk band the Miracle Workers on their European tour (with a bound-in live CD) and pens strips that range from biting satires to self-deprecating autobiography, signed by cartoonist.

COMPLETE CRUMB VOL. 1: "Early Years of Bitter Struggle" chronicles the genesis of one of the most fascinating careers in America's popular arts. The collaborations of Robert and Charles Crumb, the first appearance of Fritz the Cat, and much more! Signed by Crumb.
EXCLUSIVE ARTIST SHIRT - ED PISKOR: Limited edition shirt with art by Ed Piskor
EXCLUSIVE ARTIST SHIRT - JIM WOODRING: Limited edition shirt with art by Jim Woodring
EXCLUSIVE ARTIST SHIRT - ELEANOR DAVIS: Limited edition shirt with art by Eleanor Davis
EXCLUSIVE ARTIST SHIRT - PETER BAGGE: Limited edition shirt with art by Peter Bagge
EXCLUSIVE ARTIST SHIRT - DREW FRIEDMAN: Limited edition shirt with art by Drew Friedman
EXCLUSIVE ARTIST SHIRT - LANE MILBURN: Limited edition shirt with art by Lane Milburn
EXCLUSIVE ARTIST SHIRT - SIMON HANSELMANN: Limited edition shirt with art by Simon Hanselmann
GROTH VOICEMAIL: Gary Groth does your out-going voicemail message
PORTFOLIO REVIEW - GROTH: A phone or Skype portfolio review with Gary Groth (30 minutes)
PRE-ORDER SKETCHED SOCK MONKEY: Sock Monkey: Into the Deep Woods (80 page story book) sketched and signed by Tony Millionaire
PRE-ORDER SKETCHED BUMF: BUMF (63 page graphic novel) sketched and signed by Joe Sacco
PRE-ORDER SIGNED UNLOVABLE #3: Unlovable #3 (416 page graphic novel) signed by Esther Pearl Watson
PRE-ORDER SIGNED JIM: JIM (224 page graphic novel) signed by Jim Woodring
PRE-ORDER SIGNED MEGAHEX: Megahex (200 page graphic novel) signed by Simon Hanselmann
PRE-ORDER SIGNED SUPERTRASH: SuperTrash (220 art book) signed by Jacques Boyreau
PRE-ORDER SIGNED STRANGE SUSPENSE: paperback edition of Strange Suspense (240 page comics collection) signed by editor Blake Bell
PRE-ORDER SIGNED FILM NOIR 101: Film Noir 101 (120 page art book) signed by Mark Fertig
OLIVIER SCHRAUWEN PRINT: One limited edition 2-3 color risograph signed print by Olivier Schrauwen
JUDGMENT DAY: Classic, controversial EC science fiction from the pen of Joe Orlando (with Al Feldstein and Ray Bradbury)
YOUNG ROMANCE 2: The Early Simon & Kirby Romance Comics. 200 page comic collection featuring the best romance comics from the men who created the comics genre. These comics cover 1947-49.
WALT DISNEY'S MICKEY MOUSE VOL. 5: "Outwits the Phantom Blot". Continuing the Eisner award winning series of the 1930s series by Floyd Gottfredson (288 page comic strip collection)
WALT DISNEY'S DONALD DUCK "The Trail of the Unicorn" More of the 'good duck artist' Carl Barks in this 216 page comics collection with stories like "Luck of the North" and "Serum to Codfish Cove."
BOMB RUN AND OTHER STORIES: Into the hell of battle with John Severin, Will Elder and Kurtzman.  A 264 page comic collection.
WANDERING SON Vol 7: The gender identity-based and critically acclaimed manga from Shimura Takako. 200 page graphic novel
JIM BLANCHARD PRINT: A signed gorgeous David Bowie giclee print measuring 9x9 inches. Bowie was a Kim Thompson favorite.
OMAHA THE CAT DANCER PRINT: a huge, beautiful screen print titled "Afternoon of a Feline". Signed by Reed Waller and Kate Worley (RIP). Approximately 35" x 25" Warehouse find!

NIJIGAHARA HOLOGRAPH PRE-ORDER: pre-order a copy of Inio Asano's epic manga (200 pages) that takes place over 10 years. When legend becomes truth in a town, what must the citizens sacrifice and how can they deal with what they've done?

BOTTOMLESS BELLY BUTTON signed: In this atmospheric, nuanced 700+ page comedy-drama by Dash Shaw, the announcement of a planned divorce by Maggie & David Loony sparks a week-long family reunion at the dysfunctional family's creepy (and possibly haunted) beach house. Signed by Shaw.

FRANK signed: A unique, visionary comic, exquisitely drawn and so fully realized that readers are drawn deeply into Jim Woodring's hallucinatory mindscape. The definitive soft cover collection of one of the great cartoon achievements of the 20th century, 352 pages.
PRE-ORDER SKETCHED THE LOVE BUNGLERS: The Love Bunglers (104 page graphic novel) sketched and signed by Jaime Hernandez
PRE-ORDER SKETCHED BUDDY BUYS A DUMP: Buddy Buys a Dump (144 page graphic novel) sketched and signed by Peter Bagge
PRE-ORDER SKETCHED LUBA AND HER FAMILY: Luba and Her Family (312 page graphic novel)
PRE-ORDER SKETCHED HOW TO BE HAPPY: How to Happy (144 page graphic novel) sketched and signed by Eleanor Davis
PRE-ORDER SKETCHED JIM: JIM (224 page graphic novel) sketched and signed by Jim Woodring
PRE-ORDER SKETCHED HIP HOP FAMILY TREE VOL 2: Hip Hop Family Tree (112 page graphic novel) sketched and signed by Ed Piskor
PRE-ORDER SKETCHED LONESOME GO: The Lonesome Go (220 page graphic novel) sketched and signed by Tim Lane
PRE-ORDER SKETCHED TWELVE GEMS: Twelve Gems (220 page graphic novel) sketched and signed by Lane Milburn
PRE-ORDER SKETCHED MEGAHEX: Megahex (200 page graphic novel) sketched and signed by Simon Hanselmann
PRE-ORDER SIGNED JACK DAVIS: DRAWING AMERICAN POP CULTURE Jack Davis reprint (208 page art book) signed by Jack Davis
PRE-ORDER SIGNED UNCLE SCROOGE AND DONALD DUCK: THE SON OF THE SUN A copy of The Son of the Sun (248 comics collection) signed by Don Rosa
PRE-ORDER SIGNED ARSENE SCHRAUWEN: A copy of Arsene Schrauwen (250 page graphic novel) signed by Olivier Schrauwen
PRE-ORDER SIGNED PIRATES IN THE HEARTLAND: A copy of Pirates in the Heartland: The Mythology of S. Clay Wilson (224 page comics collection) signed by S. Clay Wilson and Patrick Rosenkranz
PRE-ORDER SIGNED HEROES OF THE COMICS BOOKS: A copy of Heroes of the Comics Books: 75 Portraits of the pioneering legends of American Comics Books signed by Drew Friedman
PRE-ORDER SIGNED PRINCE VALIANT VOL. 9: A copy of Prince Valiant Vol. 9 signed by scholar Brian Kane
COMICS HISTORY CHAT: Interview and get the gossip from Silver Age lovers, scholars and editors Mike Catron (Fantagraphics OG) and editor Bill Schelly (one hour minimum)
JOHNNY RYAN-IZED PHOTOS: (E)mail in a photo of you or a friend and Johnny Ryan will personalize it in his 'very special' way
ZIP-A-TONE TUTORIAL: Get a Zip-a-tone tutorial and lesson from master Steven Weissman via Skype. We're not talking Manga Studio here, kids, this is the real razor-edged deal!
CONOR STECHSCHULTE PRINT: One limited edition silkscreened signed print by Conor Stechschulte

PRE-ORDER SKETCHED SOCK MONKEY, part TWO: Sock Monkey: Into the Deep Woods (80 page story book) sketched and signed by Tony Millionaire. Slightly higher price than the first batch because we value Tony's drawing hand. The other hand can go to hell.
HOOKED ON COMIX DVD PACKAGE: Get all three DVDs of documentary series on alternative contemporary cartoonists, Hooked on Comix Volumes 1-3.
VIOLENZIA: Grab one of the only five physical copies of Richard Sala's latest 50 page, full-color comic with a color sketch inside by the cartoonist himself. SHE IS COMING....

UNLOVABLE #1 and #2 BOX SET: From the pages of Bust magazine, the sometimes ordinary, sometimes humiliating, often poignant and frequently hilarious exploits of '80s teen underdog Tammy Pierce. Two volumes in a slipcased set, a perfect gift item, signed.

PRE-ORDER SKETCHED TWELVE GEMS + ONE GEME: A copy of Twelve Gems sketched and signed in by Lane Milburn plus one of the SPECIAL gems with a character's etched on it, with a hand-drawn description by Milburn.
DEITCH'S WALDO POSTER: Signed Waldo posters by Kim Deitch
ARNOLD ROTH POSTER: Signed Arnold Roth Poster
USAGI YOJIMBO PRINT: A numbered Usagi Yojimbo print signed by Stan Sakai
LLOYD LLEWELLYN PRINT: A Lloyd Llewellyn print signed by Dan Clowes
LINDA MEDLEY BLACK & TAN SCREENPRINT: "Bonne Lecture" screen print 13.25 x 18 were produced by a store in Lyon where Medley had a signing. Signed by cartoonist, 2008.
PRE-ORDER THE LONESOME GO + LINOLEUM PRINT: Tim Lane's latest 200 graphic novel signed plus a linoleum print (either The Cowboy or Congress Created Dust Bowl, your choice)
LOVE AND ROCKETS POSTER: A Love and Rockets card poster by Jaime and Gilbert Hernandez

FANTAGRAPHICS PROMO TREATMENT: Send in your comic/mini/graphic novel and Marketing Director Mike Baehr will shoot promotional film and photographs for you to use as you wish. Check out a book on our website to get an example!
MIXTAPE: Choose a mixtape from either Jim Blanchard, Noah Van Sciver, Simon Hanselmann or Josh Simmons with some righteous art on the case
COMIC DRAFT WORKSHOP: Workshop your thumbnailed/penciled comics (as in not completed) with a Fantagraphics' editor via Skype or the phone. 45 minutes

FILM NOIR 101 PRINT MURDER, MY SWEET: A limited edition print featuring the MURDER, MY SWEET poster from our new book Film Noir 101: The Best 101 Noir Film Posters from the 1940s-1950s by Mark Fertig. Size approximately: 17"x22"
SIGNED PEANUTS EVERY SUNDAY: The first collection of the color Sunday strips from 1952-1955 by Charles M. Schulz (288 page full-color collection) signed by Jean Schulz.

FILM NOIR 101 PRINT THE BLUE DAHLIA: A limited edition print featuring THE BLUE DAHLIA poster from our new book Film Noir 101: The Best 101 Noir Film Posters from the 1940s-1950s by Mark Fertig. Size approximately: 17"x22"
LINDA MEDLEY COLOR SCREENPRINT: "Bonne Lecture" screen print 13.25 x 18 were produced by a store in Lyon where Medley had a signing. Numbered and signed by cartoonist, 2008.
SPIEGELMAN #4: "Mood Indigo" wrap around cover from a Boris Vian volumes, published in Germany, signed by Spiegelman. Circa 1986
SPIEGELMAN #5: "Vian 2" proof for Vian's collected short stories volume1, wrap around cover from a Boris Vian volumes, published in Germany, signed by Spiegelman. Circa 1986  7 3/4 x 11"
SPIEGELMAN #6: Vian 3. Hundred Sonnets, wrap around cover from a Boris Vian volume, published in Germany, signed by Spiegelman. Circa 1989
SPIEGELMAN #7: Vian 4 "The Commissar and the Green Panther, wrap around cover from a Boris Vian volume, published in Germany, signed by Spiegelman. Circa 1984
SPIEGELMAN #8: Vian 5 Dead Men All Have the Same Skin, wrap around cover from a Boris Vian volume, published in Germany, signed by Spiegelman. Circa 1980
SPIEGELMAN #9: Vian 6 I Wouldn't Want to Croak and Other Poems, wrap around cover from a Boris Vian volume, published in Germany, signed by Spiegelman. Circa 1985
SPIEGELMAN 10: Vian 7 Vercoquin and the Plankton,  wrap around cover from a Boris Vian volume, published in Germany, signed by Spiegelman. Circa 1982
SPIEGELMAN #11:  Vian 8 "A Snake for Everyone (librettos, songs and scenes), wrap around cover from a Boris Vian volume, published in Germany, signed by Spiegelman. Circa 1985 6 available
HORNSCHEMEIER PORTRAITS: Paul Hornschemeier will draw a portrait of you or your pet
CUSTOM CHUCKS - EMPLOYEE: Get a pair of custom Converse shoes designed (with your favorite things in mind) by a Fantagraphics' employee
YOUR NAME IN OUR BOOKS: Your name will be thanked in all 39 book this 2014 spring season
THE ONION TOUR: Take a tour hosted by A.V. Club Editor Kyle Ryan of The Onion & A.V. Club HQ in Chicago.
BASIC FANTA TOUR: Get a tour of the Fantagraphics office and warehouse in Seattle (free razorblades and coffee!)

THE LAST SUNDAY PEANUTS STRIP BY CHARLES M. SCHULZ: A 14" x 18" full color print of Schulz's farewell Peanuts strip that ran February 14, 2000 (he died in his sleep the night before). One of the loveliest and most heartfelt strips ever published,. reflecting Schulz's love for cartooning, his characters, and life. Framed.
ELEANOR DAVIS PRINT SET ($100): A set of two limited edition signed prints (two-color) by Eleanor Davis.

LINDA MEDLEY FULL COLOR PRINT: "Rackham" a limited edition full color print originally made as thank you gifts-the drawings in the frames are of the Cathedral in Metz, rooftops in Brussels, and a little bit of Marseille, plus the view out the window is the little castle Medley stayed at in Angouleme. Numbered and signed by cartoonist.
SPIEGELMAN #3: Printers proofs of wrap-around cover to Paul Auster's New York Trilogy novels signed by Spiegelman, size approximately 18 3/4" x  9 1/4" 2006.
P. CRAIG RUSSELL FOLIO: a black and white six plate folio from 1980. Numbered 403/1200. Framable quality.
VAL MAYERIK FOLIO: "Obsessions" a signed black and white six plate folio from 1988. Signed and numbered 193/1200.
NESTOR REDONDO FOLIO: "Men, Maiden and Myths" a black and white folio of five plates from 1979. Signed and numbered 179/1000. Framable quality.
BORIS VALLEJO FOLIO: "Midnight Angels" a black and white folio of six plates from 1979. A display copy (written on the very bottom of the plates), framable quality.
MICHAEL ZECK FOLIO: a black and white folio of six plates featuring The Punisher. 1986, framable quality.
MARSHALL ROGERS FOLIO: "Strange" a black and white folio of six plates. Numbered 342/1200, 1979, framable quality.
JOHN BOLTON FOLIO: a black and white folio of six plates, 1985. Framable quality.
PAUL GULACY FOLIO: a black and white folio of six plate, 1982. Framable quality.
FRANK CIROCCO FOLIO: "The Seven Dreams of Sinbad" a folio of 7 plates (6 b/w, 1 color). Signed and numbered 230/1200. 1980
RICHARD HESCOX FOLIO: "A Fatal Beauty" a folio of 6 b/w plates, signed and numbered 513/1200. Framable quality.
JERRY BINGHAM FOLIO: a black and white folio of 6 plates, 1982. Framable quality.
NEAL ADAMS FOLIO: a COLOR folio of 4 plates "Set A", 1978. Framable quality.
ALFREDO P. ALCALA FOLIO: "Voltar" a black and white folio of six prints, 1979, signed and numbered 175/1000.
ALEX NINO FOLIO: a black and white folio of nine plates, signed and numbered 431/1000, 1978.
PRE-ORDER SIGNED WITZEND COLLECTION: A slipcased edition of witzend (2 volumes, 608 page collection) signed by Howard Chaykin
PRE-ORDER SIGNED EIGHTBALL COLLECTION: A slipcased edition of The Complete Eightball (2 volume, 454 page comics collection)

THE EC COMICS SLIPCASE VOL. 1: Collecting our first four books in the NY Times Bestselling series. Corpse on the Imjin! by Harvey Kurtzman, Came the Dawn by Wallace Wood, 50 Girls 50 by Al Williamson, and 'Tain't The Meat by Jack Davis.
PRE-ORDER THE SIGNED THE BLIGHTED EYE: 416 page coffee table book; the most awesome collection of original comic art ever published. Signed by the editor/curator Glenn Bray.
OOP ARCHIVES BOOK: Choose one out-of-print book from our special archives
FBI MINI LIBRARY: One of every FBI Mini Comic + Free Comic Book Day books

PRINT TUTORIAL: Get a print buying tutorial from Fanta print buyer, Jason T. Miles, via Skype. He'll teach you industry secrets and walk you through how to find the best paper, cover stock, book cloth and more for your graphic novel/comic book project!
GROTH MOVIE NIGHT - HAPPY: Dinner and movie of Gary's choice at the Groth Manor with the Fanta crew

PRINT TUTORIAL IN THE FLESH: Get a Print Buying Tutorial from Fanta print buyer, Jason T. Miles, in person at the Fanta office. He'll teach you industry secrets and walk you through how to find the best paper, cover stock, book cloth and more for your graphic novel/comic book project! TOUCH those paper samples.
TONY MILLIONAIRE PRINT: One limited edition signed print by Tony Millionaire (weren't you watching the video?!)
TIM LANE PRINT: One limited edition signed print by Tim Lane
TIM LANE PRINT #2 TRAIN HOPPING: One limited edition signed print by Tim Lane
RETAILER SPECIAL FBI MINI LIBRARY: Three full sets of the FBI Mini Comics LIbrary to do with as you wish. You must provide your retailer number during checkout.
PRE-ORDER SIGNED EIGHTBALL COLLECTION, part 2: A slipcased edition of The Complete Eightball (2 volume, 454 page comics collection). Cover image is not final cover!

Blighted Eye JUSTIN GREEN PRINT: The iconic cover of one of the seminal 1972 autobiographical underground comics: Binky Brown Meets the Holy Virgin Mary. Scanned from the original black and white art, signed by Justin Green. Featured in the new book The Blighted Eye.

Blighted Eye GARY PANTER PRINT: Six-panel painted comic strip titled “Henry Webb” (1992), starring Panter’s every-idiot; a stand-alone painting. Signed by the artist. Featured in the new book The Blighted Eye.
Blighted Eye KIM DEITCH PRINT: “Hell.” Giclee print from a 25” x 18 ½” ink & watercolor masterpiece, 1985. Featured in the new book The Blighted Eye.
SPIEGELMAN #2: Artist proofs 2 color print, circa 1994. Size approximately 18 1/2" x 21"
BRIAN BOLLAND FOLIO: a black and white folio of six plates by Brian Bolland. 1985
ESTEBAN MAROTO FOLIO: a full-color 12 plate set, signed and numbered 462/600. 1978,
HOWARD CHAYKIN FOLIO: a black and white flio of 6 plates, signed and numbered 839/1000, 1978.

WORLD FAMOUS COMIC BOOK ARTISTS FOLIO: a black and white folio of 16 plates by Jack Kirby, Walter Simonson, Jean-Claude Gal, Bob Mc Leod, John Buscema, John Severin, Paul Gillon, Philippe Caza, Paul Smith, Mike Zeck, Brian Bolland, Yves Chaland, Howard Chaykin, Gil Kane and Mike Kaluta. 1983
MARIE & JOHN SEVERIN FOLIO: "Kull II" a black and white folio of 7 plates, signed and numbered 931/1000, 1977.
Blighted Eye ROBERT WILLIAMS PRINT: Entitled “Gaudi,” celebration of the architect Antonio Gaudi, originally published in Gothic Blimp Works, 1970. Signed by the artist.
GROTH MOVIE NIGHT - ANNOYED: Dinner and a Brian De Palma movie night in honor of Kim Thompson (and to annoy Gary) at the Groth Manor with the Fanta crew
CUSTOM CHUCKS - GARY PANTER: Get a pair of custom Converse sneakers designed/painted by Gary Panter
GILBERT HERNANDEZ PRINT: One limited edition signed print by Gilbert Hernandez
JAIME HERNANDEZ PRINT: One limited edition signed print by Jaime Hernandez
S. CLAY WILSON PRINT: One limited edition signed print by S. Clay Wilson
WOODRING PRINT: One limited edition signed print by Jim Woodring (remember the video?)
DREW FRIEDMAN PRINT: A limited edition print featuring a portrait of Steve Ditko from Friedman's new book Heroes of the Comic Books.
SIGNED DAVE STEVENS PRINT: A beautiful screen print of King Kong and Ann Darrow
TCJ MONTH AD: Fanta-designed ad for your book on The Comics Journal for a full month, the month of your choosing! ($50 off the normal price)
WEENIE ROAST: An invitation to a weenie roast for you and a guest with Gary Groth and the Fanta crew at Groth Manor

ORIGINAL DRAWING BY PAUL KARASIK & MARK NEWGARDEN + NANCY PROOFSHEET: In anticipation of Fantagraphics’ release of the game-changing book on the language of comics, How To Read Nancy, Karasik and Newgarden will collaborate on a gorgeous 4” x 4” original drawing plus an original, vintage syndicate 10” x 17” proof for a week of 1960s Nancy dailies!

Charles Burns 12 Set of Special Edition Elysian Bottles ($250): ONE OF A KIND! Twelve unused and capped EMPTY bottles from the Elysian Brewing's 12 Beers of the Apocalypse (2012) with art by Charles Burns. For the big Burns fan.
SIGNED OPUS + A B&W SKETCH: A copy of the hardcover memoir/coffee table book (224 full color pages) with a signed black and white sketch by Barry Windsor Smith.
SPIEGELMAN #1: Signed AP offset print from the 2010 Sollies Ville comics festival, size 19 3/4"x27 1/2"
SACCO SKETCHBOOK: A new sketchbook with a Joe Sacco original drawing on the first page
VAN SCIVER ALBUM ART: Noah Van Sciver will draw your next album cover for your band

PRE-ORDER SIGNED EIGHTBALL COLLECTION + BLACK AND WHITE SKETCH: A slipcased edition of The Complete Eightball (2 volume, 454 page comics collection) plus a black and white sketch drawn by Dan Clowes. Cover image is not final cover!

SIGNED Charles Burns 12 Set of Special Edition Elysian Bottles ($250): ONE OF A KIND! Twelve unused and capped EMPTY bottles from the Elysian Brewing's 12 Beers of the Apocalypse (2012) with art by Charles Burns and SIGNED by Burns. For the big Burns fan.
FRANK SANTORO CORRESPONDENCE COURSE: Enrollment to the Santoro Correspondence Comics Course, which you can do from dang near anywhere!
PRE-ORDER SIGNED EIGHTBALL + COLOR DRAWING: Dan Clowes will sign and sketch a color drawing in your copy of the new Eightball collection
FANTA DESIGNED COVER: Get one of our ace designers to design a cover for your comic (with one round of edits)
FANTA GRAND TOUR: Get the grand tour of Fantagraphics plus dinner with Gary Groth and Eric Reynolds
HOW TO CRITIQUE/EDIT COMICS: Attend a one day workshop on how to critique and edit comics by Gary Groth, Eric Reynolds and a digital Dan Nadel. In Seattle, date TBA depending on your schedule
HOW TO MAKE COMICS: Attend a one day workshop on how to transform your ideas and sketches into a finished comic by Eric Reynolds and Jen Vaughn. In Seattle, date TBA depending on your schedule
PRESS AND PROMOTION: Attend a one day workshop on comics press and promotion by Mike Baehr and Jacq Cohen. In Seattle, date TBA depending on your schedule
GRAHAM CHAFFEE TATTOO: Get a tattoo from the master tattoo artist and cartoonist of Good Dog and Big Wheels. Anytime you want but at his studio in LA. Check out his work at www.gschaffeetattoos.com

COLOR SKETCH IN UNCLE SCROOGE AND DONALD DUCK "The Son of the Sun": Don Rosa will draw a color head shot of a character of your choice with an expression of your choice that will be tipped-in to your copy of the book. Signed (and dedicated to you if you choose).

PRE-ORDER SIGNED EIGHTBALL + B/W DRAWING: Dan Clowes will sign and sketch a black and white drawing in your copy of the new Eightball collection. (2 volume, 454 page comics collection). Cover image is not final cover!

MARK TODD PAINTING + UNLOVABLE 3: Mark Todd will paint a classic Fantagraphics book cover of your choosing, 8x10". Includes a copy of Unloveable 3 by Esther Pearl Watson and Whatcha Mean, What's a Zine? by Mark Todd and Esther Pearl Watson

TIM LANE'S THE LONESOME GO COMPLETE BOX SET: Handmade box set (each one of a kind) featuring both special edition linoleum prints, both infographic prints, a mix of ephemera like Lane's radio shows, dioramas, vinyl album, DVDs, Happy Hour in America, and other zines related to The Lonesome Go and Abandoned Cars.
SIGNED OPUS + A B&W SKETCH PART 2: A copy of the hardcover memoir/coffee table book (224 full color pages) with a signed black and white sketch by Barry Windsor Smith.

PRE-ORDER SIGNED EIGHTBALL + COLOR DRAWING + RARE STICKER: Dan Clowes will sign and sketch a color drawing in your copy of the new Eightball collection, includes a rare sticker from Clowes' personal Eightball collection
HANSELMANN PAINTING: Simon Hanselmann will paint Megg, Mogg (and maybe Owl) doing anything 'within the bounds of good taste.'

GROTH SHOOTING PARTY: Go out to the local gravel pit with Gary (and a gun warden) where "we’ll take household appliances and water jugs to blow holes into." Just like you've always dreamed about! You must be 18 years old, we'll be checking your ID, dammit.

CCS CREATE COMICS CAMP: Enrollment in the Center for Cartoon Studies' Create Comics week long summer camp in White River Junction, Vermont. (housing not included) Date TBA, must be at least 16 years old
WAREHOUSE SHOPPING SPREE: 5 minute shopping spree in the Fantagraphics warehouse. Caveats: all you can carry plus the aid of one Fanta totebag, and only one copy of each book

Limited Edition WEIRDO Portfolio: Four covers of WEIRDO (#4, 8, 10 and 11) chosen to show off the eclectic graphic imagination of the artist, each suitable for framing, housed in a folio that is signed and numbered by Robert Crumb, contained in a slipcase.
SEASON OF BOOKS: All 39 books we put out for the Spring-Summer 2014 season, shipped monthly
JOB SHADOW - EDITORIAL: Shadow the editorial department for the day, learn the ins and outs, with Gary Groth, Eric Reynolds, Kristy Valenti and Mike Catron
JOB SHADOW - DESIGN: Shadow the design department for the day, learn the ins and outs, with Jason T. Miles, Tony Ong and Emory Liu
JOB SHADOW - MARKETING: Shadow the editorial department for the day, learn the ins and outs, with Mike Baehr, Jacq Cohen and Jen Vaughn
